member.name: T:Westwind.WebConnection.wwDotNetBridge
member.summary:
The wwDotNetBridge class provides a host of COM support functions for Visual FoxPro. It allows you to host the .NET runtime without relying on COM interop to load types, rather it acts as a proxy for instantiation and other tasks.
This library can be used itself to load .NET and types, or you can use it as a helper with COM interop in which case you have to instantiate it as a COM object and call its methods directly rather than using the FoxPro helper class.

member.summary: Returns error information if the call fails

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.wwDotNetBridge.CreateInstance_Internal(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Creates an instance of a class based on its type name. Assumes that the type's assembly is already loaded.
Note this will be a little slower than the versions that work with assembly name specified because this code has to search for the type first rather than directly activating it.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.wwDotNetBridge.CreateInstance_Internal(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Routine that loads an assembly by its 'application assembly name' - unsigned assemblies must be visible via the .NET path (current path or BIN dir) and GAC assemblies must be referenced by their full assembly name.

member.summary: Returns a property value by allowing . syntax to drill into nested objects. Use this method to step over objects that FoxPro can't directly access (like structs, generics etc.)

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.wwDotNetBridge.SetPropertyEx(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Sets a property of a .NET object with a value using extended syntax.
This method supports '.' syntax so you can use "Property.ChildProperty" to walk the object hierarchy in the string property parameter.
This method also supports accessing of Array/Collection indexers (Item[1])

member.summary: Invokes a method on asynchronously and fires OnCompleted and OnError events on a passed in callback object.

member.name: T:Westwind.WebConnection.EventSubscriber
member.summary: FoxPro interop access to .NET events. Handles all events of a source object for subsequent retrieval by a FoxPro client.
member.remarks: For a FoxPro program to be notified of events, it should use `wwDotNetBridge.InvokeMethodAsync` to call . When asynchronously completes, the FoxPro program should handle the event it returns and then call again to wait for the next event. The FoxPro class `EventSubscription`, which is returned by `SubscribeToEvents`, encapsulates this async wait loop.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.EventSubscriber.WaitForEvent
member.summary: Waits until an event is raised, or returns immediately if a queued event is available.
member.returns: The next event, or null if this subscriber has been disposed.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.TypePassingTests.PassEnumArray(System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons[])
member.example: LOCAL loArray as Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray loArray = loBridge.Createarray("System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons") loComValue = loBridge.CreateComValue() loComValue.SetEnum("System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons.OK") loArray.AddItem( loComValue) ? loBridge.InvokeMethod(loTest,"PassEnumArray",loArray)

member.summary: Pass in 15 parameters and return the value of the last

member.summary: Returns the full path of a full physical filename

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.FileUtils.GetFullPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a fully qualified path from a partial or relative path. Also fixes up case of the entire path **if the file exists**

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.FileUtils.GetRelativePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a relative path string from a full path.
member.param: The path to convert. Can be either a file or a directory
The base path to truncate to and replace
member.returns:
Lower case string of the relative path. If path is a directory it's returned without a backslash at the end.
Examples of returned values: .\test.txt, ..\test.txt, ..\..\..\test.txt, ., ..
member.summary: Returns a relative path string from a full path based on a base path provided.
member.param: The path to convert. Can be either a file or a directory
The base path on which relative processing is based. Should be a directory.
member.returns:
String of the relative path.
Examples of returned values: test.txt, ..\test.txt, ..\..\..\test.txt, ., .., subdir\test.txt

"|Png Image (.png)|*.png|JPEG Image (.jpeg)|*.jpeg|Gif Image (.gif)|*.gif|Tiff Image (.tiff)|*.tiff|All Files (*.*)|*.*";

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ReflectionUtils.GetTypeFromName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Helper routine that looks up a type name and tries to retrieve the full type reference using GetType() and if not found looking in the actively executing assemblies and optionally loading the specified assembly name.

Optional assembly name to load from if type cannot be loaded initially. Use for lazy loading of assemblies without taking a type dependency.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ReflectionUtils.GetTypeFromName(System.String)
member.summary: Overload for backwards compatibility which only tries to load assemblies that are already loaded in memory.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ReflectionUtils.CreateComInstance(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a COM instance from a ProgID. Loads either Exe or DLL servers.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ReflectionUtils.StringToTypedValue(System.String,System.Type,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary:
Turns a string into a typed value generically. Explicitly assigns common types and falls back on using type converters for unhandled types.
Common uses: * UI -> to data conversions * Parsers Class ReflectionUtils
member.param: The string to convert from
The type to convert to
Culture used for numeric and datetime values.
member.returns: object. Throws exception if it cannot be converted.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ReflectionUtils.StringToTypedValue``1(System.String,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Generic version allow for automatic type conversion without the explicit type parameter
member.param: input string value to be converted
Culture applied to conversion

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ReflectionUtils.TypedValueToString(System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a type to string if possible. This method supports an optional culture generically on any value. It calls the ToString() method on common types and uses a type converter on all other objects if available
member.param: The Value or Object to convert to a string
Culture for numeric and DateTime values
Return string for unsupported types

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ReflectionUtils.CallMethod(System.Object,System.String,System.Type[],System.Object[])
member.summary: Calls a method on an object dynamically. This version requires explicit specification of the parameter type signatures.
member.param: Instance of object to call method on
The method to call as a stringToTypedValue
Specify each of the types for each parameter passed. You can also pass null, but you may get errors for ambiguous methods signatures when null parameters are passed
any variable number of parameters.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ReflectionUtils.CallMethod(System.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Calls a method on an object dynamically.
This version doesn't require specific parameter signatures to be passed. Instead parameter types are inferred based on types passed. Note that if you pass a null parameter, type inferrance cannot occur and if overloads exist the call may fail. if so use the more detailed overload of this method.
member.param: Instance of object to call method on
The method to call as a stringToTypedValue
Specify each of the types for each parameter passed. You can also pass null, but you may get errors for ambiguous methods signatures when null parameters are passed
any variable number of parameters.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ReflectionUtils.InvokeEvent(System.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Allows invoking an event from an external classes where direct access is not allowed (due to 'Can only assign to left hand side of operation')
member.param: Instance of the object hosting the event
Name of the event to invoke
Optional parameters to the event handler to be invoked

Property to retrieve

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ReflectionUtils.CallMethodEx(System.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Calls a method on an object with extended . syntax (object: this Method: Entity.CalculateOrderTotal)

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ReflectionUtils.GetPropertyEx(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a property or field value using a base object and sub members including . syntax. For example, you can access: oCustomer.oData.Company with (this,"oCustomer.oData.Company") This method also supports indexers in the Property value such as: Customer.DataSet.Tables["Customers"].Rows[0]
member.param: Parent object to 'start' parsing from. Typically this will be the Page.
The property to retrieve. Example: 'Customer.Entity.Company'

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ReflectionUtils.GetPropertyInfoEx(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a PropertyInfo object for a given dynamically accessed property
Property selection can be specified using . syntax ("Address.Street" or "DataTable[0].Rows[1]") hence the 'Ex' name for this function.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ReflectionUtils.SetPropertyEx(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets a value on an object. Supports . syntax for named properties (ie. Customer.Entity.Company) as well as indexers.
member.param: Object to set the property on.
Property to set. Can be an object hierarchy with . syntax and can include indexers. Examples: Customer.Entity.Company, Customer.DataSet.Tables["Customers"].Rows[0]
Value to set the property to

member.summary: Returns a property or field value using a base object and sub members including . syntax. For example, you can access: oCustomer.oData.Company with (this,"oCustomer.oData.Company")
member.param: Parent object to 'start' parsing from.
The property to retrieve. Example: 'oBus.oData.Company'

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ReflectionUtils.SetPropertyCom(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the property on an object.
member.param: Object to set property on
Name of the property to set
value to set it to

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ReflectionUtils.SetPropertyExCom(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Sets the value of a field or property via Reflection. This method alws for using '.' syntax to specify objects multiple levels down.
ReflectionUtils.SetPropertyEx(this,"Invoice.LineItemsCount",10)
which would be equivalent of:
Invoice.LineItemsCount = 10;
member.param: Object to set the property on.
Property to set. Can be an object hierarchy with . syntax.
Value to set the property to

member.name: T:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray
member.summary:
COM Wrapper for Arrays, IList and IDictionary collections that are not directly or easily accessible in FoxPro. Provides members like `Count`, `Item()` for index or key retrieval, `AddItem()`, `AddDictionaryItem()`, `RemoveItem()`, `Clear()` to provide common collection operations more naturally in FoxPro abstracted for the different types of collections available in .NET (Arrays, Lists, Hash tables, Dictionaries).
Internally stores an instance of the collection so the collection is never actually passed to FoxPro. Instead this class acts as a proxy to the collection which is stored in the `.Instance` property.
This instance allows Visual FoxPro to manipulate the collection by directly accessing array, list or dictionary values by index or key (depending on list or collection), adding, removing and clearing items, creating array, list and dictionary instances and assigning and picking up these values from existing objects.
This class is also internally used to capture collections that are returned from method calls or Properties via `InvokeMethod()` and `GetProperty()` and can be used to pass collections to .NET which otherwise would not be possible over COM.

member.name: P:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.Instance
member.summary: The actual array instance returned as an object. This instance is set and passed to and from .NET calls made with InvokeMethod and explicit property assignments with Set/GetProperty.

member.name: P:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.Count
member.summary: Returns the length of the .NET array contained in Instance

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a new COM Array instance from an existing collection instance

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.AddItem(System.Object)
member.summary:
Adds an item to the internal list, array or single item collection.
The list or collection has to exist or an exception is thrown.
member.param: an instance of the item to add.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.Add(System.Object)
member.summary:
Adds an item to the internal list or collection/dictionary.
The list or collection has to exist or an exception is thrown.
member.param: an instance of the item to add.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.AddDictionaryItem(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary:
Adds an item to the dictionary by key and value.
**The list or collection has to exist or an exception is thrown.**
member.param: Dictionary key used to look up this item.
an instance of the item to add.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.SetItem(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Updates a value to an existing collection or list item by int index for lists, or a key or value for dictionaries/collections
member.param: int 0 based index or any type for key on collections/dictionaries

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.RemoveItem(System.Object)
member.summary:
Removes an item from the collection.
Depending on the item is a List style item (Array, List, HashSet, simple Collections) or a Key Value type collection (Dictionary or custom key value collections like StringCollection), you specify an index (lists), value (Hash tables/collections), or a key (Dictionary).
member.param: 0 based list index or value for a Hash table, or a key to a collection/dictionary

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.Remove(System.Object)
member.summary:
Removes an item from the collection.
Depending on the item is a List style item (Array, List, HashSet, simple Collections) or a Key Value type collection (Dictionary or custom key value collections like StringCollection), you specify an index (lists), value (Hash tables/collections), or a key (Dictionary).
member.param: 0 based list index or value for a Hash table, or a key to a collection/dictionary

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.Clear
member.summary: Clears out the collection's content.

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.CreateItem
member.summary:
Creates an instance of the collection's data member type without actually adding it to the array. This is useful to quickly create empty objects that can be populated in FoxPro without specifying the full typename each time resulting in cleaner code in FoxPro.
**Assumes that the collection `Instance` is set or null is returned**
Arrays must have at least 1 item, while generic lists can deduce from the Generic Type parameters.
member.returns: Item created or null, or if no items or unable to create (or object

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.CreateArray(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Creates a new array instance with size number of items pre-set. Elements are unassigned but array is dimensioned. Use 0 for an empty array.
Use SetItem() to assign values to each array element
member.param: The type of the array's elements
Size of array to create

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.CreateList(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an empty List of T.
member.param: .NET Type of the items in the List

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.CreateDictionary(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an empty Dictionary with specified key value types
member.param: .NET Typename of the Key
.NET Typename of the collection Data items

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.AssignFrom(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Assigns a .NET collect to this ComArray Instance. Has to be passed as a base instance (ie. parent instance of the array) and the name of the array because once the array hits VFP code it's already been converted into a VFP array so only internal reflection will allow getting the actual reference into ComArray.
member.param: Instance of the parent object of the array
Name of the array property on the parent instance

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.AssignTo(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Assigns this ComArray's array instance to the specified property

member.name: M:Westwind.WebConnection.ComArray.FromEnumerable(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary:
Creates a copied array instance from an enumerable.
If enumerables aren't bound to a concrete list/collection and retrieved one at a time, there's no way to return it to FoxPro unless it's materialized into some sort of list.
This method makes a copy of the enumerable and allows you to iterate over it.
You can update existing items in the array, but you cannot add/remove/clear items and affect the underlying enumerable. If the type is truly Enumerated it won't support updating either, so this is not really a restriction imposed here.
If the underlying enumerable is a concrete list or collection type you should be able to use the relevant Add/Remove/Clear methods directly without requiring this method to make a copy.

member.name: T:Westwind.WebConnection.ComGuid
member.summary: .NET System.Guid values cannot be passed to VFP as they are non COM exported value types. So any Guid values passed to and received from .NET need to be passed around as a ComGuid instance. This class wraps an internal Guid instance member and allows access to the GuidString property via string.
